column4: In the middle of burning a CD, I got an error.  What i noticed what my ROM got unmounted.  Now, I can't even get the cd out.  Any way to remount?  Don't feel like rebooting.
did you try unmounting via GUI under the "computer" section ?
Just tried.  Says unable to mount.  No media in drive.
it does not offer the unmount option? if so i'll get you the commandline command
thing is, it unmounted by itself.  It just disappeared from the panel
check whats your CD-rom by using "df" then "unmount /dev/hdX" could work, i'm not even sure
sudo eject -r
that ejected my second drive (with no cd in it)
output of df http://tinypaste.com/6b148
hmm i'm not sure then :( Can't find a way to tell the eject command which cd-rom to use :(
post the content of /etc/fstab to no-paste
an quick and dirty way would be to use the paperclip and press into the small hole/button to force ecject it :D
fstab http://paste.ubuntu.com/173993/
eject -r -v /dev/scd0 or "eject -r -v /dev/scd1"
scd1 ejected my second drive (the one with no probs), scd0 gave http://paste.ubuntu.com/173995/
try using sudo, next try this command: "sudo eject -s -v /dev/sdc0"
same issue
okay, i used the paper clip, it was still spinning
i guess i should reboot, but i hope it wont unmount again
maybe yeah
thanks for your help
oh well it wasnt of any use really ;)
